text: Anna Brzezińska (born 9 January 1971 in Brzeg, Opole Voivodeship) is a retired Polish middle-distance runner who specialized in the 1500 metres. She adopted the New Zealand nationality on 1999-01-22. ==Achievements== {| |- ! colspan="6" | Representing |- | rowspan=2 | 1992 | European Indoor Championships | Genoa, Italy | align="center" | 6th | 1500 m | 4:09.05 |- | Olympic Games | Barcelona, Spain | align="center" | semifinal | 1500 m | 4:15.53 |- | rowspan=2 | 1993 | World Indoor Championships | Toronto, Ontario, Canada | align="center" | 4th | 1500 m | 4:11.15 |- | World Championships | Stuttgart, Germany | align="center" | 7th | 1500 m | 4:08.11 |- | rowspan=3 | 1994 | European Indoor Championships | Paris, France | bgcolor="cc9966" align="center" | 3rd | 3000 m | 8:56.90 |- | rowspan=2 | European Championships | rowspan=2 | Helsinki, Finland | 8th | 800m | 2:00.41 |- | 9th | 1500m | 4:20.89 |- | 1996 | Olympic Games | Atlanta, U.S. | align="center" | 12th | 1500 m | 4:08.27 |} ==References== * * Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:New Zealand female middle-distance runners Category:Polish female middle-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Poland Category:People from Brzeg Category:Sportspeople from Opole Voivodeship
title: Anna Brzezińska (athlete)
